title: WHERE ARE THE DMS???
text: I don‚Äôt understand why the basic functionality of sharing things with your friends within the app isn‚Äôt a main priority for Threads. The connection to Instagram seems really short sighted in the long run as I feel Threads and Instagram cater to completely different audiences which hinders Threads from having its own individual identity. I get excited for every update hoping that they add this simple feature but they never do it. Threads is exactly like Twitter but with less features. It‚Äôs hard to justify spending any time at all on the app when you know you are investing in a lesser experience. I would give it a higher rating but it‚Äôs been months and the updates have been very lackluster. To say I am disappointed is an understatement. People deserve better.

title: Make it stop.
text:
Threads takes the name ‚Äòmeta‚Äô to a whole new level. A leftist echo chamber, you‚Äôll be hard pressed to find a single post that isn‚Äôt a) running defense for the app itself, b) dragging Elon like an obsessive ex or c) giving insight on how to grow your Threads following - the end goal of which I assume is to have a larger audience in front of which to talk about Threads and Elon? 

All that aside, my real issue with Threads is the 24/7 push notifications and teaser posts on IG when I DO NOT USE THREADS. The app is not on my phone nor will it ever be, yet there is an ever present ‚Äú9+‚Äù notifications bubble at the top of my IG profile.

title: It‚Äôs Twitter 2.0
text: It feels just like Twitter. Yeah, I know they‚Äôve changed their name to X. But X is not a name. It‚Äôs a letter. I refuse to call them X. Threads feels similar. There‚Äôs a character count maximum (not sure what it is) just like on Twitter. Today is my first day on here. Perhaps we should be asked to review sites after a few days of using.

title: Not much use

title: Cesspool of Hate
text: The issue with twitter was always the rampant white supremacy that goes uncontrolled by the company itself. You have the exact same issue with threads, meaning there is no point for this app to even exist. If you are willing to moderate bigots, maybe I'd consider using this platform.

title: Hot and fresh
text: It‚Äôs basically Twitter but better because it‚Äôs tied in with Instagram. I‚Äôm a poet and a photographer have been wishing for a more integrated experience with the photos and poetry captions I post on Instagram. This platform feels vibrant and alive to me. It makes me feel more whole.
